title: Active Learning Loop
body: Capture user feedback on AI suggestions for model improvement.

title: Graph Timeline Playback
body: Allow playback view of investigation history.

title: Collaborative Annotations
body: Add ability to share comments/annotations on graph nodes/edges.

title: Insight Generation via LLM
body: Generate natural-language insights from graph data.

title: GNN Link Prediction
body: Prototype GNN for predictive entity relation suggestions.

title: Monitoring Setup
body: Add Prometheus + Grafana for backend and Neo4j metrics.

title: CI/CD Setup
body: Configure GitHub Actions for linting, testing, and deployment.

title: RBAC with JWT
body: Implement role-based access control (admin/editor/viewer) via JWT.

title: Activity Logs & Audit Trail
body: Track edits, views, and tagging changes in logs.

title: Export Graph Data
body: Enable graph export to CSV, JSON, and PDF.

title: Docker Dev Orchestration
body: Merge Docker Compose configs into unified setup with `.env`.

title: Initial NLP Tagging
body: Add LLM-based NLP tagging to parse documents (e.g., PDF, TXT).

title: Real-Time Collaboration
body: Integrate WebSocket (Socket.IO) for real-time graph syncing.

title: Graph Visualization Finalization
body: Ensure Cytoscape.js graph is interactive and stable.

title: Entity CRUD APIs
body: Finalize GraphQL and REST endpoints for entity CRUD.

title: Epic: Proactive Threat Anticipation via Predictive Graph AI
body:
### Epic
Proactive Threat Anticipation via Predictive Graph AI

### Milestone
MVP1-Predictive-AI

### Child Issues
- [ ] Predictive Model Training Pipeline
- [ ] Alerting & Notification System

title: Epic: Collaborative Intelligence War Rooms
body:
### Epic
Collaborative Intelligence War Rooms

### Milestone
MVP1-Collaboration

### Child Issues
- [ ] War Room Creation Flow
- [ ] War Room Graph Sync
- [ ] Integrated Video Conferencing

title: Epic: Real-Time Threat Simulation & 'What-If' Analysis
body:
### Epic
Real-Time Threat Simulation & 'What-If' Analysis

### Milestone

### Child Issues

- [ ] Simulation Engine Backend

body:

Federated Intelligence Search Across Distributed Graphs

### Milestone

### Child Issues

- [ ] Instance Connection Management UI

title: Epic: Autonomous Investigation Copilot
body:
### Epic
Autonomous Investigation Copilot

### Milestone
MVP1-Copilot

### Child Issues
- [ ] Copilot Goal Definition UI
- [ ] Copilot Query Orchestration
- [ ] Copilot Report Generation

title: Epic: Unified Multimodal Intelligence Graph
body:
### Epic
Unified Multimodal Intelligence Graph

### Milestone
MVP1-Core-Graph

### Child Issues
- [ ] Design Multimodal Data Schema
- [ ] Implement AI-based Entity Extraction for Images
- [ ] Implement AI-based Entity Extraction for Audio

title: War Room Creation Flow
body:
### Description
UI flow to create and name a war room, assign participants.

### Acceptance Criteria
- User can create/join war room with role-based permissions.


Spec: docs/mvp1/War_Room_Creation_Flow.md

title: Alerting & Notification System
body:
### Description
Trigger alerts when model predicts emerging threats above threshold.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Alerts sent via UI and optional email/SMS.
- Links to predicted affected graph nodes.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Alerting_&_Notification_System.md

title: Copilot Report Generation
body:
### Description
Generate structured investigation reports from copilot findings.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Reports include findings, evidence, and confidence scores.
- Exportable as PDF/HTML.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Copilot_Report_Generation.md

title: Simulation Engine Backend
body:
### Description
Backend service to propagate effects of simulated events through the graph.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Simulation correctly models cascading impacts.
- API returns impacted node list.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Simulation_Engine_Backend.md

title: Design Multimodal Data Schema
body:
### Description
Design a graph schema that supports entities and relationships extracted from text, image, audio, and video sources.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Schema supports linking entities across modalities.
- Tested with mixed-media datasets.
- Documented in developer wiki.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Design_Multimodal_Data_Schema.md

title: Implement AI-based Entity Extraction for Audio
body:
### Description
Integrate speech-to-text and audio event recognition to extract entities and relationships from audio files.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Audio files processed produce text transcripts and detected events/entities.
- Integrates with multimodal ingestion.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Implement_AI-based_Entity_Extraction_for_Audio.md

title: Predictive Model Training Pipeline
body:
### Description
Develop pipeline to train graph-based ML models for threat anticipation.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Pipeline ingests historical graph data and trains prediction models.
- Model accuracy evaluated against test set.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Predictive_Model_Training_Pipeline.md

title: Integrated Video Conferencing
body:
### Description
Embed secure video/audio conferencing within war room interface.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Participants can join call directly from war room.
- Uses WebRTC or similar.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Integrated_Video_Conferencing.md

title: Copilot Query Orchestration
body:
### Description
Backend service to translate goals into a sequence of queries and analytics tasks.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Goals generate executable query plans.
- Supports manual override of plan steps.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Copilot_Query_Orchestration.md

title: Implement AI-based Entity Extraction for Images
body:
### Description
Integrate an image recognition model to detect and label entities from image datasets.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Images processed produce entity nodes with confidence scores.
- At least 80% accuracy on validation dataset.
- Integrates into ingestion pipeline.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Implement_AI-based_Entity_Extraction_for_Images.md

title: Simulation Scenario Builder
body:
### Description
UI for defining simulation scenarios and affected nodes/edges.

### Acceptance Criteria
- User can select nodes/edges and assign simulated events.
- Saved scenario can be re-run.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Simulation_Scenario_Builder.md

title: Federated Search API
body:
### Description
Create GraphQL resolvers for querying across multiple connected Intelgraph instances.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Query returns aggregated results from all connected instances.
- Respects ACLs of remote data.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Federated_Search_API.md

title: War Room Graph Sync
body:
### Description
Real-time synchronization of graph edits across war room participants.

### Acceptance Criteria
- All participants see updates in <300ms latency.
- Conflict resolution implemented.


Spec: docs/mvp1/War_Room_Graph_Sync.md

title: Copilot Goal Definition UI
body:
### Description
Create a UI panel for analysts to define investigation objectives/goals for the copilot.

### Acceptance Criteria
- User can input text-based goals.
- Goals saved in backend for copilot processing.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Copilot_Goal_Definition_UI.md

title: Instance Connection Management UI
body:
### Description
Add UI to connect/disconnect remote Intelgraph instances for federation.

### Acceptance Criteria
- Admin can view and manage connected instances.
- Connection status displayed in real time.


Spec: docs/mvp1/Instance_Connection_Management_UI.md

body:
Bumps [husky](https://github.com/typicode/husky) from 8.0.3 to 9.1.7.
Release notes

Sourced from husky's releases.

v9.1.7

What's Changed

  • fix: add husky label to deprecated warning by @​smackfu in typicode/husky#1538

New Contributors

  • @​smackfu made their first contribution in typicode/husky#1538

Full Changelog: https://github.com/typicode/husky/compare/v9.1.6...v9.1.7

v9.1.6

New Contributors

  • @​OlegKipchatov made their first contribution in typicode/husky#1495
  • @​Byron2016 made their first contribution in typicode/husky#1499
  • @​dexmlee made their first contribution in typicode/husky#1519

Full Changelog: https://github.com/typicode/husky/compare/v9.1.5...v9.1.6

v9.1.5

What's Changed

  • fixes #1494, support pre-merge-commit hook by @​RainMeoCat in typicode/husky#1497

New Contributors

  • @​RainMeoCat made their first contribution in typicode/husky#1497

Full Changelog: https://github.com/typicode/husky/compare/v9.1.4...v9.1.5

v9.1.4

  • Improve deprecation notice

v9.1.3

  • fix: better handle space in PATH

v9.1.2

Show a message instead of automatically removing deprecated code.

This only concerns projects that still have the following code in their hooks:

- #!/usr/bin/env sh # <- This is deprecated, remove it
- . "$(dirname -- "$0")/_/husky.sh"  # <- This is deprecated, remove it

Rest of your hook code

Hooks with these lines will fail in v10.0.0

v9.1.1

title: chore(deps-dev): bump lint-staged from 13.3.0 to 16.1.5

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update javascript code

body:
Bumps [lint-staged](https://github.com/lint-staged/lint-staged) from 13.3.0 to 16.1.5.
Release notes

Sourced from lint-staged's releases.

v16.1.5

Patch Changes

  • #1608 4e3ce22 Thanks @​srsatt! - Detect the git repo's top-level directory correctly when in a worktree.

v16.1.4

Patch Changes

  • #1604 90b37b0 Thanks @​iiroj! - Add another types field to package.json to make even more sure NPM detects that lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.

v16.1.3

Patch Changes

  • #1602 7ea700b Thanks @​dword-design! - Add the types field to package.json to make sure NPM detects lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.

v16.1.2

Patch Changes

  • #1570 a7c0c88 Thanks @​ItsNickBarry! - When using --diff-filter with the D option to include deleted staged files, lint-staged no longer tries to stage the deleted files, unless they're no longer deleted. Previously this caused an error from git add like fatal: pathspec 'deleted-file' did not match any files.

  • 38f942e Thanks @​iiroj! - Removed an extraneous log entry that printed shouldHidePArtiallyStagedFiles to console output.

v16.1.1

Patch Changes

  • #1565 3686977 Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged now explicitly warns about potential data loss when using --no-stash.

  • #1571 02299a9 Thanks @​iiroj! - Function tasks (introduced in v16.0.0) only receive the staged files matching the configured glob, instead of all staged files.

  • #1563 bc61c74 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version fixes incorrect behavior where unstaged changes were committed when using the --no-stash option. This happened because --no-stash implied --no-hide-partially-staged, meaning unstaged changes to files which also had other staged changes were added to the commit by lint-staged; this is no longer the case.

    The previous (incorrect) behavior can still be achieved by using both options --no-stash --no-hide-partially-staged at the same time.

v16.1.0

Minor Changes

  • #1536 e729daa Thanks @​iiroj! - A new flag --no-revert has been introduced for when task modifications should be applied to the index before aborting the commit in case of errors. By default, lint-staged will clear all task modifications and revert to the original state.

  • #1550 b27fa3f Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged now ignores symlinks and leaves them out from the list of staged files.

Patch Changes

  • #1558 c37dc38 Thanks @​iiroj! - The minimum required Node.js version is lowered to 20.17 following nano-spawn@1.0.2.

v16.0.0

Major Changes

  • #1546 158d15c Thanks @​iiroj! - Processes are spawned using nano-spawn instead of execa. If you are using Node.js scripts as tasks, you might need to explicitly run them with node, especially when using Windows:

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from lint-staged's changelog.

16.1.5

Patch Changes

  • #1608 4e3ce22 Thanks @​srsatt! - Detect the git repo's top-level directory correctly when in a worktree.

16.1.4

Patch Changes

  • #1604 90b37b0 Thanks @​iiroj! - Add another types field to package.json to make even more sure NPM detects that lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.

16.1.3

Patch Changes

  • #1602 7ea700b Thanks @​dword-design! - Add the types field to package.json to make sure NPM detects lint-staged includes built-in TypeScript type definitions.

16.1.2

Patch Changes

  • #1570 a7c0c88 Thanks @​ItsNickBarry! - When using --diff-filter with the D option to include deleted staged files, lint-staged no longer tries to stage the deleted files, unless they're no longer deleted. Previously this caused an error from git add like fatal: pathspec 'deleted-file' did not match any files.

  • 38f942e Thanks @​iiroj! - Removed an extraneous log entry that printed shouldHidePArtiallyStagedFiles to console output.

16.1.1

Patch Changes

  • #1565 3686977 Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged now explicitly warns about potential data loss when using --no-stash.

  • #1571 02299a9 Thanks @​iiroj! - Function tasks (introduced in v16.0.0) only receive the staged files matching the configured glob, instead of all staged files.

  • #1563 bc61c74 Thanks @​iiroj! - This version fixes incorrect behavior where unstaged changes were committed when using the --no-stash option. This happened because --no-stash implied --no-hide-partially-staged, meaning unstaged changes to files which also had other staged changes were added to the commit by lint-staged; this is no longer the case.

    The previous (incorrect) behavior can still be achieved by using both options --no-stash --no-hide-partially-staged at the same time.

16.1.0

Minor Changes

  • #1536 e729daa Thanks @​iiroj! - A new flag --no-revert has been introduced for when task modifications should be applied to the index before aborting the commit in case of errors. By default, lint-staged will clear all task modifications and revert to the original state.

  • #1550 b27fa3f Thanks @​iiroj! - Lint-staged now ignores symlinks and leaves them out from the list of staged files.

Patch Changes

  • #1558 c37dc38 Thanks @​iiroj! - The minimum required Node.js version is lowered to 20.17 following nano-spawn@1.0.2.

... (truncated)

  • 690d7c2 build(deps): update dependencies
  • 4e3ce22 fix: fix the incorrect relativeTopLevelDir detection when working with the wo...
  • 9151254 chore(changeset): release
  • 90b37b0 fix: add root-level "types" field to package.json
  • 795be13 chore(changeset): release
  • 4463089 build(deps): update dependencies
  • 7ea700b fix: allow npm to detect built-in TypeScript type definitions
  • 0a0a701 test: make sure "git amend" works as expected

title: Audit and Harden Docker Configurations
body:
**Issue ID:** IG-73

**Description**
Review dev/prod Docker files for security (e.g., non-root users, minimal images).

**Priority:** High

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Updated docker-compose.yml. 
- Security scans pass. 
- Best practices documented.

title: Integrate Basic OSINT Connector (e.g., WHOIS API)
body:
**Issue ID:** IG-72

**Description**
Add a plugin stub for WHOIS enrichment, as per README.

**Priority:** Medium

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Sample connector code committed. 
- Enriches entity with mock data. 
- Documented usage.

title: Add PWA Support for Mobile Responsiveness
body:
**Issue ID:** IG-71

**Description**
Make frontend responsive and add PWA manifest for mobile access.

**Priority:** Low

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Manifest.json committed. 
- Tested on mobile emulator. 
- Offline mode stubbed.

title: Set Up Basic Testing Framework (Jest/Cypress)
body:
**Issue ID:** IG-70

**Description**
Add Jest for unit tests and Cypress for E2E, with initial coverage for backend stubs.

**Priority:** High

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Tests run with npm test. 
- >50% coverage on existing code. 
- Integrated into CI workflow.

title: Create Roadmap Document for MVP and Beyond
body:
**Issue ID:** IG-69

**Description**
Document MVP features, post-MVP (AI, collaboration), in ROADMAP.md.

**Priority:** Medium

**Acceptance Criteria**
- ROADMAP.md committed. 
- Aligned with README and existing milestone. 
- Prioritized features listed.

title: Implement Basic Entity Modeling in Neo4j
body:
**Issue ID:** IG-68

**Description**
Define Neo4j schema for entities/relationships with sample Cypher queries.

**Priority:** High

**Acceptance Criteria**
- Cypher scripts committed. 
- Sample data loaded via script. 
- Queries tested in Neo4j browser.

title: Add Stub for AI/ML Service (Link Prediction)
body:
**Issue ID:** IG-67

**Description**
Create a Python or TensorFlow.js stub for basic link prediction, integrable with backend.

**Priority:** Medium

**Acceptance Criteria**
- ML service endpoint returns mock predictions. 
- Documented integration. 
- Tested with sample graph data.

title: Bootstrap Basic GraphQL Schema and Resolvers
body:
**Issue ID:** IG-66

**Description**
Set up Apollo GraphQL in server/ with basic schema for entities/relationships, as per README.

**Priority:** High

**Acceptance Criteria**
- GraphQL playground at /graphql. 
- Sample query for entity CRUD. 
- Integrated with Neo4j stub.

title: Repo hygiene: enforce LFS or ban large binaries
body:
Prevent accidental commits of large jars/zips (e.g., >50MB) via LFS or pre-commit/CI guardrail.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Pre-commit hook or CI fails on oversize binaries.
- [ ] README notes policy and remediation.

title: Graceful shutdown: close HTTP + DB clients on SIGINT/SIGTERM
body:
Ensure we close HTTP server, PG pool, Redis client, and Neo4j driver on process signals.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Logs show clean shutdown steps.
- [ ] Exit code 0 if shutdown clean within timeout.
- [ ] Restart after shutdown succeeds without lingering handles.

title: Add /api/version endpoint
body:
Return `name` and `version` fields from `package.json` at `/api/version`.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `/api/version` returns `{ name, version }`.
- [ ] Covered by a tiny test.

title: Docs: one-command local bootstrap (README + .env.example)
body:
Provide `.env.example` and quickstart steps for Docker + server dev.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `.env.example` includes PG/Neo4j/Redis variables.
- [ ] README has copy-paste compose up, and health checks.
- [ ] Troubleshooting section for common Mac/Docker quirks.

title: Security posture: SECURITY.md and Dependabot
body:
Add `SECURITY.md` (vuln reporting path) and enable Dependabot for `npm`, `github-actions`, and Docker.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] SECURITY.md present and linked in README.
- [ ] Dependabot configured with weekly cadence.
- [ ] Sample PR from Dependabot appears.

title: CI: add Node 20 workflow (lint, build, test)
body:
Create GitHub Actions workflow:
- `node@20.x`
- `npm ci`, `npm run lint`, `npm test`
- Cache `~/.npm`

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] PRs run workflow automatically.
- [ ] Fails on lint or tests.
- [ ] Status checks required on `main` branch protection (documented).

title: Redis: clean connection lifecycle to avoid 'already connecting' states
body:
Fix Redis client reuse and disconnection to prevent “already connecting/connected” errors on startup or reload.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Singleton client with idempotent `connect()`.
- [ ] Graceful shutdown handler closes the client.
- [ ] `/api/readyz` redis path is stable across restarts.
- [ ] Unit test simulates two consecutive `connect()` calls without error.

title: Postgres dev container: stable init and user/database
body:
Pin Alpine PG image and init script to create database and user consistently.

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] PG listens on 5432 mapped to localhost.
- [ ] `psql` from host can `SELECT 1;`.
- [ ] Adminer can log in with documented creds.
- [ ] README documents `.env` and compose overrides.

title: Neo4j dev container: enforce non-default password & GDS plugin
body:
Ensure Neo4j dev container:
- Uses `NEO4J_AUTH=neo4j/<non-default>`
- Installs GDS plugin at a pinned, compatible version
- Starts healthy and is reachable on bolt `7687`

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Logs show startup and bolt listening.
- [ ] `cypher-shell` returns `1` via `RETURN 1`.
- [ ] Password is **not** default `neo4j`.
- [ ] README documents `.env` values and quickstart.

title: GraphQL: minimal schema+resolver skeleton
body:
Keep a minimal GraphQL surface to support `/graphql` (e.g., `type Query { ping: String! }`).

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `Query.ping` returns `"pong"`.
- [ ] Apollo server boots with CORS/Helmet defaults.
- [ ] `/graphql` responds to introspection when `NODE_ENV=development`.
- [ ] Basic test verifies `{ ping }` query.

title: Harden /api/readyz and /api/healthz
body:
Aggregate DB checks into readiness (`/api/readyz`) and liveness (`/api/healthz`).

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `/api/readyz` returns `ok:true` only if PG, Neo4j, Redis probes pass.
- [ ] `/api/healthz` returns `ok:true` if server loop is alive (no DB requirement).
- [ ] Redis connection handling is idempotent (no “already connecting/connected”).
- [ ] 503 on failure with per-service detail.
- [ ] Minimal tests assert shape and HTTP codes.

title: Add DB health endpoints (/api/db/*)
body:
Add explicit DB health endpoints:
- `GET /api/db/pg` → `{ ok, now }`
- `GET /api/db/neo4j` → `{ ok, version }`
- `GET /api/db/redis` → `{ ok, pong }`

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `/api/db/pg` runs `SELECT now()` and returns HTTP 200 with `ok:true`.
- [ ] `/api/db/neo4j` runs `RETURN 1` and returns HTTP 200 with `ok:true`.
- [ ] `/api/db/redis` calls `PING` and returns HTTP 200 with `ok:true`.
- [ ] Errors return HTTP 503 with `ok:false` and a helpful `detail`.
- [ ] Covered by lightweight integration tests.

title: Docs: ADR-0001 — Define MVP-0 scope and constraints
body:
# Docs: ADR-0001 — Define MVP-0 scope and constraints

**Scope**
- Architectural Decision Record capturing MVP-0 boundaries and trade-offs.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] `/docs/adr/0001-mvp-scope.md` created
- [ ] References to future work deferred

title: Docs: Create docs/roadmap.md and link from README
body:
# Docs: Create docs/roadmap.md and link from README

**Scope**
- Create `docs/roadmap.md` with MVP-0/1 milestones and track planned features.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] Roadmap present and up to date
- [ ] README links to roadmap

title: M6: Sentry integration (client & server) via env
body:
# M6: Sentry integration (client & server) via env

**Task**
- Wire Sentry DSNs from env vars; no keys in repo.

**Done when**
- [ ] Errors captured with release and commit SHA
- [ ] Docs updated with SENTRY_DSN setup

title: M6: Request logging and /metrics endpoint
body:
# M6: Request logging and /metrics endpoint

**Task**
- Add Winston JSON request logs and a lightweight `/metrics` route (basic counters).

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] Logs include reqId, userId, path, latency
- [ ] /metrics exposes counters suitable for scraping

title: M5: Louvain community detection (experimental)
body:
# M5: Louvain community detection (experimental)

**Summary**
Run Louvain via Neo4j GDS, write communityId back to nodes, and expose filter in UI.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] API endpoint to trigger algorithm for an Investigation
- [ ] Results written to nodes as `communityId`
- [ ] UI filter + legend
- [ ] Metrics logged; feature flagged as Experimental

title: M4: WHOIS enrichment connector (domain → entity)
body:
# M4: WHOIS enrichment connector (domain → entity)

**Summary**
Call WHOIS API for a domain list and create/update Domain entities with key fields.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] Server endpoint that fetches WHOIS in batches
- [ ] Rate-limit and error handling
- [ ] UI action to enrich selected nodes

title: M4: CSV upload → graph import (upsert)
body:
# M4: CSV upload → graph import (upsert)

**Summary**
Allow users to upload a CSV and map fields to Entity/Relationship properties; upsert by unique key.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] Upload endpoint with size/type limits
- [ ] Mapping UI for columns → properties
- [ ] Upsert behavior (dedupe) and error reporting
- [ ] Unit tests for mapping

title: M3: Graph viewer (Cytoscape) with basic layout
body:
# M3: Graph viewer (Cytoscape) with basic layout

**Summary**
Render Entities/Relationships for an Investigation using Cytoscape (or similar).

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] Nodes and edges display with labels
- [ ] Pan/zoom, simple layout, selection highlights metadata
- [ ] Handles 1k nodes without freezing (dev machine)

title: M3: Investigations list/create/detail views
body:
# M3: Investigations list/create/detail views

**Summary**
Implement minimal UI to list and create Investigations and view detail.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] List shows name/owner/updatedAt
- [ ] Create flow posts to GraphQL and updates list
- [ ] Detail page with basic metadata

title: M3: Frontend auth (login/logout) and token storage
body:
# M3: Frontend auth (login/logout) and token storage

**Summary**
Build basic auth screens and integrate with API.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] Login form, error handling, logout
- [ ] Access token stored securely (httponly cookie or memory + refresh flow)
- [ ] E2E smoke: login → navigate → logout

title: M2: Environment config schema validation
body:
# M2: Environment config schema validation

**Task**
- Validate required env vars at startup (zod or joi). Prohibit running if missing/invalid.
- No secrets committed to repo.

**Done when**
- [ ] App fails fast on missing/invalid env vars
- [ ] Docs updated with required keys

title: M2: JWT auth (access+refresh) with roles (admin, analyst, viewer)
body:
# M2: JWT auth (access+refresh) with roles (admin, analyst, viewer)

**Summary**
Implement auth middleware and role checks around protected mutations/queries.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] argon2 password hashing
- [ ] JWT access (15m) + refresh (7d)
- [ ] Role guard on protected resolvers
- [ ] Tests cover happy path and unauthorized cases

title: M2: Neo4j constraints and indexes bootstrap
body:
# M2: Neo4j constraints and indexes bootstrap

**Task**
- Script to create unique constraints and necessary indexes for core nodes/relationships.
- Run automatically on server startup (idempotent).

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] Script exists under `/server/infra/neo4j-init`
- [ ] Running twice causes no errors
- [ ] Measured query improvements for basic CRUD

title: M2: GraphQL schema for User, Investigation, Entity, Relationship
body:
# M2: GraphQL schema for User, Investigation, Entity, Relationship

**Summary**
Define core GraphQL types and CRUD operations (MVP).

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] `schema.graphql` with types: User, Investigation, Entity, Relationship
- [ ] CRUD resolvers for Investigation & Entity (read-only for Relationship initially)
- [ ] Input validation and basic error handling
- [ ] Unit tests for resolvers

title: M1: Branch protection & CODEOWNERS
body:
# M1: Branch protection & CODEOWNERS

**Scope**
- Add `CODEOWNERS` (e.g., @BrianCLong + reviewer).
- Protect `main` to require 1 review and green CI.

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] CODEOWNERS file exists
- [ ] Branch protection active on `main`

title: M1: Enable Dependabot and secret scanning
body:
# M1: Enable Dependabot and secret scanning

**Task**
- Add `.github/dependabot.yml` for npm and GitHub Actions.
- Turn on GitHub Advanced Security features available (secret scanning, Dependabot alerts).

**Done when**
- [ ] Dependabot PRs appear for outdated deps
- [ ] Secret scanning enabled in repo settings

title: M1: GitHub Actions CI for client and server (lint, test, build)
body:
# M1: GitHub Actions CI for client and server (lint, test, build)

**Scope**
- Node 18 matrix for `client` and `server`.
- Steps: checkout → setup-node → `npm ci` → lint → test → build → (optional) docker build --no-cache

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] CI required on PRs and `main`
- [ ] Passing status displayed on README badge

title: M0: Add .editorconfig, Prettier, ESLint, and pre-commit hooks
body:
# M0: Add .editorconfig, Prettier, ESLint, and pre-commit hooks

**Task**
- Standardize formatting and linting for client/server.
- Add `lint-staged` + pre-commit hooks.
- Ensure `npm run lint` and `npm run format` work in both workspaces.

**Done when**
- [ ] CI job runs lint/typecheck
- [ ] No lint errors on main

title: M0: Add LICENSE, CODE_OF_CONDUCT, CONTRIBUTING, SECURITY.md
body:
# M0: Add LICENSE, CODE_OF_CONDUCT, CONTRIBUTING, SECURITY.md

**Scope**
- Choose a license (MIT recommended for now).
- Add CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md (Contributor Covenant), CONTRIBUTING.md (how to run dev, tests, commit style), SECURITY.md (private disclosure path).

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] Four docs added and visible
- [ ] README links to them

title: M0: Update README to reflect MVP-0 truth and move extras to Roadmap
body:
# M0: Update README to reflect MVP-0 truth and move extras to Roadmap

**Scope**
- Trim README to the minimal, currently-implemented features (MVP-0).
- Add a `docs/roadmap.md` with Planned items (SSO, MFA, ABAC, Helm/K8s, OTel, Prometheus).

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] README describes only shipped features with working commands
- [ ] `docs/roadmap.md` created and linked from README

title: Meta: Track IntelGraph bootstrap tasks
body:
This is a tracking issue to confirm labels and issue creation via gh CLI works.

- [ ] Confirm labels exist
- [ ] Add templates to repo
- [ ] Wire CI & Dependabot

title: M0: Normalize filenames and organize repo structure
body:
**Task**
- Remove duplicate or suffixed files (e.g., ).
- Move stray root JS files into proper directories (, ).
- Ensure no spaces in filenames and consistent kebabCase or camelCase.

**Done when**
- [ ] No duplicate variants remain
- [ ] Frontend code in , backend in 
- [ ] CI passes lint

title: M0: Remove sensitive files from history and add proper .gitignore
body:
**Task**
- Use  (or BFG) to remove , , and any  (e.g., intelgraph_boost.zip) from the entire history.
- Add , ,  to .
- Rotate any secrets that may have been committed.

**Area**: devops/ci, security

**Done when**
- [ ] Repo history contains no secrets/binaries listed above
- [ ] New  present and effective
- [ ] Documentation updated in README (brief note on secrets handling)
